page.title: 01STANHOE AND ITS AREA
page.content: This is an intensively farmed area lying between 40m and 70m O.D. It is served by relatively few metalled roads but has a number of unmade green lanes which were formerly of importance but are now used for farm traffic and walkers. Hedges divide the large fields most of which are devoted to arable farming though some stock is present too. It is still very much a community though perhaps not so strongly as in the past. Apart from four cottages and a farm in the hamlet of Shammar, all the houses lie within the parish of Stanhoe and with two exceptions are in the cluster of houses which make up this small village. Stanhoe supports a church, Chapel, Post Office, Public House and Village Hall but within the last ten years lost its school and second shop.
